meanings.definition: To receive more votes than (someone) in an election.
meanings.sent1: In the election, Sarah outpolled her opponent by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: The candidate outpolled all others and won the election.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit outpolled the turtle in the race for class president.
meanings.sent4: The sunflower outpolled the other flowers in height, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: Outpolling her competitors, Lily secured her victory in the school election.
